column3: Published by national or subnational governments (e.g, branches, departments, secretariats, etc.)
Published by multinational organizations (e.g., UNEP, EU, WHO)
Published by academic expert panels. Can be a synthesis or technical advice
Formal applications or impact statements submitted to authorities by proponents—independent from the government—seeking permits or approvals
Published by declared Think Tank organizations
Applies to multiple countries or globally
Applies to a multi-country region (e.g., European Union)
Applies to a province, state, and/or municipal level
Not clearly ecological or atypical settings (e.g. rural areas)
Not clearly specified (e.g. when the policy talked about computer tools used for any environment)
Biodiversity protection, habitat or species policies
Infrastructure or land use in urban areas
Meeting economic and social goals without compromising the environment, wildlife and natural resources
Public health and well-being impacts of noise

Industry involved in producing and supplying fuel and power, including extraction, generation, transmission, and distribution (e.g. fossil fuels, nuclear, renewables, infrastructure like energy grids, pipelines)
Topics like defence or education (e.g. mineral mining, animal welfare)
